item.title: New Steam Shooter Game is Already a Big Hit
item.description:
Highlights

  • Gray Zone Warfare sells over 500,000 copies in just four days, proving to be a hit on Steam.
  • Despite mixed player reviews, developers are working on improvements to enhance gameplay experience.
  • Fans compare the game to Escape from Tarkov, highlighting potential for growth and success.

Gray Zone Warfare , a new tactical first person shooter MMO that popped up on Steam at the end of April, is already drawing in big player numbers despite being just a few days old. Although Gray Zone Warfare is still in Early Access, it has already managed to sell more than half a million copies in its first four days since release.

Founded in 2008, Czech Republic-based indie developer and publisher MADFINGER Games is best known in the mobile game market , where it has produced highly rated FPS games like the Shadowgun series and other titles like Samurai: Way of the Warrior and the zombie-themed Dead Trigger . Gray Zone Warfare and its expansions are MADFINGER Games' only entries on Steam, offering team-based cooperative PvE gameplay and competitive PvEvP modes.

Related
Gray Zone Warfare: Negotiator Task Guide
Here's what you'll need to do in Gray Zone Warfare to complete the Negotiator task.

In its first four days in Early Access on Steam, Gray Zone Warfare has managed to sell more than 500,000 copies of its base game and 250,000 copies of its Tactical Edition Upgrade DLC, according to a release from MADFINGER Games. Both pieces of software became available on April 30, and the developers have stated that they have already released two hotfixes and are working on more improvements to the game, with the third hotfix expected to arrive early next week. A lot of fans seem to be comparing the game to extraction shooter Escape from Tarkov , with the potential to elevate it to new heights as the developers have more time to add to and refine the product.

Not Everyone is Loving Gray Zone Warfare

Despite Gray Zone Warfare 's impressive early sales figures, player reviews for the game are mixed, with only 66 percent of its more than 20,000 reviewers recommending it. While some players leaving a thumbs down are still giving the Early Access title time to develop before they make a final ruling, some others have complained about problems with the game's core mechanics. These complaints include blurry graphics, game lag, sound issues, frequent crashes, and inconsistent hit registration. Some players have also reported losing looted gear and weapons in Gray Zone Warfare due to server malfunctions.

Still, a majority of players seem to be enjoying their first few days with the shooter while acknowledging that the game could use a little bit of polish. One reviewer, OJz, gave it a thumbs up despite the current build only being worthy of a 3/10 score, as they said they saw the potential for MADFINGER games to raise that score to an 8/10 by fixing its problems. While a lot of players seem to feel that the functionality of the guns and ammo in Gray Zone Warfare — probably the most vital elements of an FPS — could use some improvement, that and other criticisms don't seem to be slowing down the game's commercial success.

item.title: Persona 5 Royal Mod Lets You Play Doom In-Game
item.description:
Highlights

  • Fans have successfully ported Doom into Persona 5 Royal, allowing players to enjoy the iconic shooter within the JRPG world.
  • The mod is based on the shareware version of Doom, offering the first level and the opportunity to purchase the full game in-game.
  • Joker can buy Doom for 670 yen, with Morgana acknowledging the game's influence in the '90s and providing unique flavor text.

Fans have gotten id Software's classic shooter Doom playable within Atlus' hit JRPG, Persona 5 Royal . The iconic first-person shooter game is one of id Software's most beloved titles, having been ported to several different video game systems over the past three decades. The effort hasn't stopped at official ports to consoles, as Doom is also quite famous for having been ported to non-gaming devices , including but not limited to a Google Smart Clock, an Amiga 2600, and many others. Some fans have now managed to get the game running within Persona 5 Royal .

Persona 5 Royal is an updated re-release of one of Atlus' most successful JRPG releases. Much like the original Persona 5 , players have the chance to engage in a variety of activities. This includes playing video games in the attic of their home base, Leblanc, after purchasing a retro game set from a secondhand shop. While these retro games are rendered as mini-games that give the player a social stat boost, some modders have gotten the feature to allow gamers to play Doom .

Related
Doom Is Getting Ported to a Lawn Mower
Anyone who has ever wondered whether a lawn mower can run Doom can finally rest assured that the answer to that question is a resounding 'yes.'

The mod was created by Xan1242 and KingJack, with the first video showcase by JRPG YouTuber Faz. In this demonstration video, Joker can buy Doom in-game for 670 yen. Morgana actually has some unique flavor text upon purchasing the game, where he acknowledges how Doom was one of the most influential FPS games in the '90s. The player can then boot the game up in the hideout, which is shown as a red cartridge that is placed in Joker's console, much like how Doom had a red SNES cart when it was ported to the system.

Doom Running in Persona 5 Royal

This port is based on the shareware version of the game, meaning the mod only covers the first level of Doom , "Knee-Deep in the Dead." Both the in-game tutorial and Morgana acknowledge this is the shareware version, and that if players manage to beat it, they can purchase the full version of the game through the in-game secondhand shop (though the Doom.wad file must be in the mod's Doomsona folder). Faz then demonstrates how the game fully runs in Persona 5 Royal , killing demons with ease.

Upon quitting the game, Morgana notes how Joker killing all the imps and demons must have resulted in a stat boost, with this game increasing Joker's Guts stat in Royal . While the full version of the mod isn't publicly available yet, Faz has provided links to the mod's work on GitHub and GameBanana, noting it will be released later.

item.title: Helldivers 2 is Being Review Bombed
item.description:
Highlights

  • Helldivers 2 is facing backlash for requiring Steam users to link with PlayStation Network, leading to negative user reviews.
  • Despite controversy, Helldivers 2 remains popular with new content regularly released for players to enjoy.

Helldivers 2 is being review bombed by Steam users who are upset about the game's requirement to link with a PlayStation Network account. Helldivers 2 is unique in that it is a PlayStation-published game that launched simultaneously on PC and PS5. While PlayStation exclusives have been making their way to PC in recent years, it's usually quite some time between the launch of the PS5 version and its eventual PC port.

Helldivers 2 's multi-platform release has paid off big time, helping the game become one of the most popular new releases of the entire year. There's no denying that Helldivers 2 has been a smash hit on Steam , with many praising it as an example of a live-service game done right. While Helldivers 2 has been enjoying a great deal of praise from the community, the game is now finding itself being review bombed by disgruntled members of the community.

Related
Helldivers 2 Players Make Unexpected Discovery on Terminid Planets After Patch
Helldivers 2 players uncover new mysteries on Terminid planets, sparking speculation about hidden threats lurking beneath the surface.

At launch, Helldivers 2 suffered from some technical problems that convinced Sony to offer a "grace period" when it came to the requirement to link one's Steam account to the PlayStation Network . However, the company recently indicated that the grace period is expiring, meaning Steam users will have to link to a PlayStation Network account if they want to continue playing Helldivers 2 . As some might have guessed, this has greatly upset some Steam users, and they have started leaving negative reviews on the game's Steam page and Metacritic as a result.

Helldivers 2 Flooded With Negative User Reviews

The negative reviews, which consist of 0/10 and 1/10 scores, mainly complain about the account linking requirement. Some of the reviews mention dissatisfaction with some of the recent Helldivers 2 updates , but that seems to be minor compared to the real controversy. Sony has given no indication that it intends on backing down from the Helldivers 2 account linking requirement, and so it remains to be seen what exactly will come about from this situation.

Typically, Helldivers 2 is quick to respond to community feedback and concerns, but the developers' hands may be tied in this case. It seems unlikely that Sony will reverse course and remove the restriction to require Steam users to link to a PlayStation Network account, but time will tell.

Despite this controversy, Helldivers 2 remains an incredibly popular game. Developer Arrowhead Game Studios has regularly released new Helldivers 2 content to keep fans engaged, and there's plenty more on the way, like the Polar Patriots Warbond that's coming on May 9.

item.title: Rumor: Popular Soulslike From 2023 Could Be Coming to Xbox Game Pass Soon
item.description:
Highlights

  • Game Pass subscribers are in for a treat with the possible addition of Lords of the Fallen, a well-received Soulslike game.
  • Microsoft has been consistently adding quality content to Xbox Game Pass.
  • Microsoft may surprise Game Pass subscribers with the arrival of Lords of the Fallen later this month.

A recent report from a reputable Xbox insider suggests that one of 2023's biggest Soulslikes, Lords of the Fallen , could be coming to Xbox Game Pass in the near future. If true, the addition of this relatively new AAA game to the popular subscription service would mark yet another major inclusion to Xbox Game Pass , which has received consistent, quality content in recent months.

Game Pass subscribers have largely had it good so far in 2024, as Microsoft has treated fans to a number of notable additions to the service lately. Titles like Persona 3 Reload , Dead Island 2 , Tales of Arise , Palworld , Star Wars Jedi: Survivor , Evil West , Eiyuden Chronicle : Hundred Heroes , and Diablo 4 are only some of the several big games that have been added to Game Pass recently. Despite a lack of first-party releases in early 2024 from Microsoft themselves, the company has still managed to provide a steady stream of noteworthy Game Pass content to satiate fans for the time being. While many Xbox gamers are currently looking toward the release of Hellblade 2 on May 16 as the next big addition to the service, it seems that Microsoft might even have a big surprise in store for Game Pass subscribers later this month.

3:15
Related
Xbox Game Pass Adds AAA Game With 86 Metacritic Score
The first title to reach Xbox Game Pass in May 2024 is a triple-A experience with excellent reviews from fans and critics alike.

According to a report from Xbox insider eXtas1s on eXputer, 2023's Lords of the Fallen , the well-received Soulslike from Romanian developer Hexworks, is set to release on Xbox Game Pass later this month. Sources close to the prominent leaker reportedly told them that the game is currently scheduled to drop on Microsoft's subscription service sometime during the final week of May. Though eXtas1s claims they did receive an exact date as to when the graphically-stunning Soulslike will be added to Game Pass, they declined to share it publicly in the event that "there are last-minute plans to up the release by a day or two."

Lords of the Fallen Would Be a Great Addition to Xbox Game Pass

This rumor comes shortly after the final free update for Lords of the Fallen was released back in April 2024. The update in question, titled Master of Fate, added a number of new features and fixes to the game, from quality-of-life enhancements and performance improvements to stat modifiers and questlines, among other things. With development on Lords of the Fallen seemingly wrapping up, it makes sense, then, that Hexworks would like to let the fully-realized version of its game reach a wider audience by releasing it on a subscription service. If this is indeed the case, then it would certainly be a welcome surprise for many Xbox fans looking to play a new Soulslike on Xbox Game Pass.

Even if this particular rumor doesn't turn out to be true, members of Microsoft's popular subscription service still have several new releases to look forward to later this month. In fact, Xbox recently confirmed four games set to release on Game Pass in May 2024 , including critically-acclaimed hits like Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition and day-one additions like Little Kitty Big City . As usual, more games will be announced for Xbox Game Pass in the second half of May, and hopefully, Lords of the Fallen will be among them.

item.title: Grounded Releases Update 1.4.1
item.description:
Highlights

  • Grounded's 1.4.1 update brings major fixes
  • Optimization improvements across the board in the latest Grounded update for better performance and smoother multiplayer gameplay.
  • Obsidian Entertainment's last major content update for Grounded was Fully Yolked.

A new update has been released for Grounded , with several major issues being addressed. These changes include balance updates, bug fixes, and optimization improvements across the board that should make Grounded that much more enjoyable for both new and returning players.

Starting as an early access title in 2020, Grounded quickly grew in popularity , offering players a unique twist on the popular survival genre. In Grounded , players are shrunken down to the size of insects as they try and stay alive in their own backyard. Getting started in Grounded can be quite a challenge, with players being tasked with finding materials, upgrading items, and fighting a variety of enemy bugs like spiders, ants, and bees. The gameplay and design of Grounded will be especially exciting for fans of classic sci-fi adventures, with the game being reminiscent of iconic films like Disney's Honey I Shrunk The Kids. In order to succeed, players will need to use all of their best survival instincts, with Grounded recently receiving some serious upgrades in its latest patch.

5:09
Related
Grounded: How To Get The Haze Lab BURGL Chip
Obtaining the BURG.L chip from the Haze Lab in Grounded requires players to complete a few steps before claiming the prize.

Obsidian Entertainment has released the official patch notes for Grounded 's 1.4.1 update, which brings a plethora of changes that seek to improve the already popular survival game. Major changes include fixes to Grounded 's respawn mechanic, with players no longer respawning with a dark screen for 3 seconds after dying. Alongside normal enemy encounters, Grounded also features boss fights , with this being a key focal point in the game's latest update. Players will now notice that Boss shout attacks and Wasp Drone shouts will no longer trigger infusion AOE attacks while in New Game+. In addition, creatures involved with base attacks, as well as Waft Emitter attacks, will now no longer freeze. Milk Molar upgrades will now correctly carry over when players activate New Game+ in Grounded .

Other changes include a fix to the Microsoft Account login screen, which previously displayed the wrong error message, and improvements to how bases load in-game. Optimization upgrades abound in Grounded 's 1.4.1 update, with performance improving across the game as a whole. Memory usage has been reduced, with rendering performance of interior locations being significantly improved. Players will also notice smoother performance while playing Grounded's multiplayer mode as a result.

Obsidian Entertainment rolled out Grounded 's last major content update earlier this year, the Fully Yolked update. This update brought about some major changes to Grounded but also acted as the game's final major update. With Grounded 's Fully Yolked update being the last confirmed piece of new content coming to the game, fans have been left speculating about the possibility of a sequel in the future.

Grounded Update 1.4.1 Patch Notes

MAJOR FIXES:

  • Players no longer respawn with a dark screen for 3 seconds after dying to a boss and respawning in Single player.
  • Creatures involved in base attacks or Waft Emitter attacks no longer freeze up for clients when arriving.
  • Boss shout attacks and Wasp Drone shouts in New Game+ no longer trigger infusion AOE attacks on anything their shout hits.
  • Milk Molar upgrades for clients properly carry over when activating New Game+.
  • Bases no longer load in with some structures incorrectly noting that they are supporting the entire base.
  • Fixed the Microsoft Account login screen incorrectly showing the wrong environment error (fixed in prior hot fix build).

CHANGES:

  • Increased damage reduction amount for the random trinket status effect “+Damage Resist” from 10% to 50%.
  • You can activate text chat via the gamepad on consoles.

OPTIMIZATIONS:

  • Improved performance across the game in general.
  • Improved performance when playing in Multiplayer mode.
  • Reduced memory usage across the game.
  • Playgrounds with lots of links will run with better performance when in Play mode.
  • Improved rendering performance inside interior spaces on lower settings.

CRASH FIXES:

  • Fixed crash that could occur sometimes after looting a dead pet and an autosave triggers.
  • Fixed crash that could occur when completing a conversation.
  • Fixed crash that could occur when a client rejoins a game where their last saved data was while they were knocked out.
  • Fixed crash that could occur when a client loads into a yard with bases built.
  • Fixed crashes that could occur randomly during playthroughs.

OTHER BUG FIXES:

  • Voice Chat settings properly reapply after closing and reopening the game.
  • Loading a game while in the Pond Lab no longer shows an underwater effect onscreen.
  • A few pieces of the oak lab roots no longer pop out at a short distance on Low settings.
  • Lighting properly transitions if a defense event is active.
  • Pond lab cutscene properly works for clients who are far away when the cutscene activates.
  • Duplicating infused weapons properly copy over the random effect.
  • Improved water quality on low settings.
  • Clients no longer get a Raw Science notification immediately on join.
  • Siren lights near the Black Anthill boss fight properly animate when in view.

NINTENDO SWITCH

  • The water fog when looking outside of the Pond Lab dome no longer pops in and out.
  • Improved performance in the various labs that are displaying a camera feed to a door you unlock.
  • Reduced the amount of art popping that happens in interiors.
  • Playgrounds properly load on the Switch.
  • Host and Client mics are properly detected if they don't have their mics connected into the Switch when joining a game and later connect one.
